title: BBC Local Live: Shropshire on Friday 28 July 2017 - BBC News
summary: bridgnorth man held in switzerland over racing allegations .
roundabout road works to take an extra day .
no offers for shrewsbury town goalkeeper .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: golf : chesters leads the european open
text: shropshire 's ashley chesters is leading the european open by one shot after shooting a five under par in the second round today .
play was held up earlier today because the ground was waterlogged .

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: outbreaks of rain and strong winds will continue through tonight eventually clearing away to give a drier end to the night with clear spells .
it will remain on the mild side for most - lows of 14c ( 57f ) .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: reabrook roundabout work to take one more day
text: work on shrewsbury 's reabrook roundabout was due to finish today , 26 days later than originally planned - but shropshire council now says it wo n't reopen until tomorrow evening .

the traffic island was first closed three months ago , along with haycock way and part of old potts way , with the local authority saying the improvements were held up by the discovery of underground drains .
some cones and signs will remain up until monday and it means the work on the english bridge gyratory system will be put back a day and start on tuesday .
the council has blamed `` recent bad weather '' for the latest hold-up .

documents.title: councils repeat opposition to merger
text: the leaders of shropshire 's two big councils have again said they have no intention of merging .

two of the county 's mps , owen paterson and daniel kawczynski have suggested they should be combined , to save money , but councillors shaun davies and peter nutting said they were `` working with a completely different set of circumstances '' .

the two authority leaders also said there was a `` great deal of co-operation between the two councils '' and the leader of telford and wrekin , mr davies said there was `` absolutely no appetite for merger with any other council '' .
although we may not agree politically , we must be pragmatic and co-operate when it is reasonable and possible to do so .
i see no advantage in spending time and effort pursuing a merger of the two councils when there are much more important issues to tackle including growing our economies ''

documents.title: tour organiser denies accusation of racing
text: the organiser of a driving tour of europe says people taking part were warned about `` extreme '' driving laws in switzerland , but has insisted no-one taking part was racing .

a bridgnorth man and two others are being held over alleged violations of swiss motoring laws , but james cannon said the men were being held for nothing more than `` minor driving offences '' including a `` small speeding issue '' , that in the uk would have been a `` slap on the wrist '' .
prosecutors have suggested to the swiss media the men were being held for taking part in a street race , an offence punishable by up to four years in prison .
car races have been completely banned in switzerland since 1955 when 84 people died in a crash .

documents.title: runner 'furious ' at declined record bid
text: runner 'furious ' at declined record bid

documents.title: shropshire bike with an ironbridge flavour is built
text: two shropshire firms have come together to make bicycles with a model of the iron bridge on the back of them .
madeley 's fabweld steel products has made copies of the landmark and bicycles by design from coalport has produced special frames to attach them to .
there are three types of ironbridge bicycle , each named after important dates in industrial history and one has already been sold to norway .
author: Ian Perry
BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: wedding plans upset by swiss 'racing ' arrest
text: the daughter of a bridgnorth man has had to postpone her wedding because he is being held in switzerland over allegations he was racing on the motorway .

david bentley , 49 , was taking part in cannon run 3000 , which organisers have described as a `` luxury driving holiday for every car fan '' taking in europe 's best roads with an emphasis on `` safe driving '' .
he and two others were driving three nissan gt-rs ( mr bentley 's car above ) from maidstone to monaco when they were arrested near zurich .
two of the men have spent their birthdays in prison .

documents.title: your photos : sun breaking through the cloud in ellesmere and longnor
text: the sun has been trying its best to break through the cloud this afternoon .
these photos were taken by bbc weather watchers in ellesmere ( top ) and longnor ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: bridgnorth man held in switzerland over alleged motoring offences
text: three britons , including a 49-year-old from bridgnorth , have been held for seven weeks without charge in switzerland over `` minor driving offences '' during an organised motoring holiday .
david bentley and the other two were taking part in the cannon run , a european driving tour .
they were arrested on 4 june and have been held in custody since without bail .
it is alleged they were racing their cars on a swiss motorway which could result in a four-year prison term .
james cannon , tour organiser and friend of the trio , denied the accusation .
swiss prosecutors said the men were being held over possible violations of switzerland 's road traffic laws .

documents.title: stray cow greets bridge users in shrewsbury
text: motorists and pedestrians using kingsland bridge in shrewsbury got a surprise this morning when a stray cow greeted them .
author: Shropshire Live

documents.title: 'stay away ' from search warning
text: 'stay away ' from search warning

documents.title: football : no offers for leutwiler
text: with a month to go until the end of the summer transfer window , shrewsbury town are still waiting to receive an offer for their out-of-favour goalkeeper jayson leutwiler .

manager paul hurst has already made it known he wants a change of keeper and he recently signed dean henderson from manchester united , but said it was nothing personal against his first-choice goalie from last season .
despite the lack of interest in the canadian international , hurst said `` i still believe that his future will lie away from his football club '' and added `` it only takes one phone call '' .
there 's no issue whatsoever on a personal level .
i just have other keepers that i 'm looking to work with and jayson understands that . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: community group close to hsbc bank agreement
text: hsbc is considering an offer to turn its bank in wellington into a community arts centre .
the branch closed last year and the clifton community arts group has been looking for an agreement to rent the building .

it explained the matter is complicated because hsbc is itself leasing the building from the freeholder , but said agents for the bank has now said it would be willing to accept the offer , subject to a few amendments .
the next step would be to raise £ 315,000 to equip and refurbish the building .

documents.title: warning over fake rubbish collectors
text: doorstep callers are going around telford , offering to take away people 's rubbish for a small fee , and then dumping it nearby .
telford and wrekin council is warning that people who pay to have their waste taking away without carrying out the proper checks face a £ 300 fine .
earlier this week , a man was fined £ 700 by the council for paying someone to dispose of his caravan - which turned up dumped in a village road .
it is vital that you do your checks on the person you plan to use to do it for you .
you need to know who they are , what vehicle they will use to take away the waste and where they are taking it to .
get the details of their waste carrier licence and make sure you get a receipt . ''

documents.title: swimming : medal for shropshire 's charlie hutchison
text: an ellesmere titans swimmer has won gb 's first swimming medal at the european youth olym in hungary .
charlie hutchison took bronze in the 400 metres individual medley .
hutchison is also targeting a medal in the 200 metres backstroke final .
club mate pia murray will be competing in the 100 butterfly final .
it 's great to say i 'm the first medallist , it 's a really good feeling , the atmosphere has been amazing , and hearing all my team cheering me was fantastic . ''
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: runner has world record dreams dashed
text: a runner , originally from west felton , near oswestry , has had her hopes for a world record dashed .
amy hughes logged 520 miles on a treadmill over seven days in september - three more than the world record .
however , she is now `` furious '' after guinness world records ( gwr ) declined it citing her boyfriend , who logged the challenge , as not being independent .
gwr said official witnesses should not be linked with record attempters .

documents.title: your photos : thick cloud in alberbury and longnor
text: the weather is remaining cloudy and damp , but the grey skies have been brightened by some rainbows and robbie from alberbury photographed one this morning .
we 've also had this moody photo from regular contributor peter steggles .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: golf : shropshire golfer tied for lead at european open
text: hawkstone park golfer ashley chesters is tied for the lead on his second round at the european open in hamburg .
he 's four under par after 11 holes today , having shot 68 yesterday .
the tournament has a prize fund totalling two million euros .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: celebration to mark completion of church restoration
text: there 's going to be in a celebration in myndtown , near bishop 's castle , to mark the end of repair work on the village church .
the 12th century building was being restored with the help of a heritage lottery grant and fund-raising by local people .
author: Genevieve Tudor
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: police officers cycle ride to remember fallen colleagues
text: more than 30 police officers from around the uk are passing through the area today , on a 180-mile ( 290km ) cycle ride in remembrance of colleagues who have lost their lives in the line of duty .

the police unity tour will be passing through herefordshire , shropshire , staffordshire , warwickshire and worcestershire over the next two days , finishing at the national memorial arboretum at alrewas .

deputy chief constable amanda blakeman ( above right ) from west mercia police is among them and she said she was taking part to remember pc richard gray who was shot dead in shrewsbury in 2007 , while trying to arrest a gunman who was holding two fellow officers hostage .

documents.title: coach driver jailed for a41 crash
text: the driver of a coach that ploughed into a stationary queue of traffic has been jailed for eight months .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: plans for new retirement homes in shrewsbury
text: developers are planning to build 32 retirement apartments on wenlock road in shrewsbury .
parking concerns have been raised and council officers want to ensure there are enough spaces for those who 'll live there .
a report going before councillors recommends the plans be approved .
author: Alex Seftel
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: walk-in centre closure putting pressure on a & e
text: the trust that runs shropshire 's two main acute hospitals says accident and emergency is under more pressure at the princess royal hospital in telford , since it announced that the walk-in centre at the site is to close .
the malling health wrekin gp practice provides urgent non-emergency care as well as routine gp appointments and patients have been choosing to go to a & e instead , since the decision was made .
the doctors surgery will shut on monday , but the walk-in centre will continue to offer appointments until 9 august .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: more than 1,500 sign knife angel petition
text: a petition calling for the oswestry knife angel to be installed on the empty fourth plinth in trafalgar square has gathered over 1,500 signatures .
it is made up of knives surrendered to police forces around the country and is currently standing outside the british ironworks centre , where it was built .
the petition calls for `` this incredible national monument to fulfil its destiny '' by raising awareness of knife crime .

documents.title: church £ 200k restoration complete
text: church £ 200k restoration complete

documents.title: video : your 50-second weather forecast
text: after a bright start cloud will start to increase with outbreaks of showery rain expected this afternoon .
a breezy day with top temperatures of around 20c ( 68f ) .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: welcome to our live updates for the day
text: welcome to live updates from bbc shropshire on friday morning .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid or message via facebook .

documents.title: 'old-fashioned handshake ' now for stone
text: 'old-fashioned handshake ' now for stone

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: special olym torch relay begins
text: the special olym torch has been lit in shropshire ahead of the gb national games which begin in sheffield in august .
the former england football manager sam allardyce was guest of honour in much wenlock , where the relay began .
the event is backed by the football league managers ' association .
the games , which are for athletes for learning disabilities , will begin on 7 august .

documents.title: building equipment stolen in newport
text: police say they have cctv footage of thieves stealing a large quantity of equipment from a building site in newport over the weekend .
they say it shows the intruders breaking into the rear of the victoria hotel on st marys street and a white truck , a white van and a flat bed lorry then driving off along water lane .

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: most places should become largely dry with clear spells overnight , with perhaps the odd shower around .
it will be a breezy night - lows of 13c ( 55f ) .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: cricket : devon malcolm 's finest hour
text: the former england bowler devon malcolm has been in the county today .
and as the 100th test match is being played at the oval today , we thought we 'd look back at his finest hour there - in 1994 .

documents.title: life-saving award for footballers
text: three members of a walking football club in shrewsbury have been presented with awards by the royal humane society , for saving the life of a fellow player in november last year .
norman pryce , david walker and mick lewis spotted ray moreland sitting on the ground with his hands on his knees and breathing abnormally and gave him cpr until an ambulance arrived .
mr moreland recieved treatment at hospital for a heart attack and is now said to be `` recovering well '' .
words are totally inadequate to sum up what i feel .
the team of norman , dave and mick saved my life .
i get tearful about it every time i reflect on their efforts .
we have built up firm friendships playing walking football .
thanks for your support and for giving me back the rest of my life . ''

documents.title: clock ticking for hospitals review
text: if plans to reorganise shropshire hospital services do n't go out to consultation in september , they could be held up for another six months , the chief executive of the shrewsbury and telford hospital trust has said .

speaking at a trust board meeting , simon wright explained that the current round of treasury funding would only be available until november , so the plans had to go through a period of consultation before then .
the hospitals ' head of planned care , mark cheetham told the meeting that if and when the future fit plans are approved , they are likely to take five years to implement .
the current recommendations are to base emergency medicine in shrewsbury along with specialist women and children 's services , while moving planned operations to telford .

documents.title: hospitals review reaches 'critical three weeks '
text: the next three weeks will be critical to the review of hospital services in the county , one of the leaders of the future fit programme has said .

debbie vogler has been speaking at a board meeting of the shrewsbury and telford hospital trust and said she understood people 's frustrations over the pace of the review , which started three and a half years ago .
but she would not reveal the findings of an independent review of the work done so far , which was commissioned following concerns about the way future fit had come its conclusions .
a series of meetings will have to be held over the coming weeks before the reorganisation plans can be put out to public consultation .

documents.title: hospitals have over 800 volunteers
text: the hospitals in shrewsbury and telford are now supported by over 800 volunteers , the largest number outside london , a trust board meeting has been told this afternoon .
committee member julia clarke said that figure includes over 100 youth volunteers .
the volunteers are able to offer non clinical support to patients , their relatives and to visitors .

documents.title: your photos : more cloud over shropshire
text: we 've seen a lot of cloud around shropshire today , and that 's reflected in the photos being shared by the bbc weather watchers .
these ones were taken near longnor ( top ) and oswestry ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: council disagrees with telford description
text: the inclusion of telford in a study alongside less-prosperous towns with low numbers of skilled workers and few innovative private firms has baffled telford and wrekin council .
it has responded to the centre for cities report into the impact of brexit by saying `` telford and wrekin is clearly the exception to the rule '' .

the local authority describes the town as a centre for `` manufacturing , information and communication and business services '' and a `` foreign investment hotspot '' with the borough attracting £ 114m of investment during 2016-17 .

the report had suggested that the towns likely to see little economic downturn as a result of brexit are those `` less prosperous places in the north , midlands and wales '' and included telford in that group .

documents.title: educational wildlife garden opens in shrewsbury
text: the shropshire wildlife trust has opened a new play area in shrewsbury to teach young people about nature .
the wild child garden was designed with the help of pupils from the coleham primary school and the severndale specialist academy and is aimed at children aged 2-12 .
it includes a `` mud kitchen '' , where children can make mud pies , a two mole tunnels , a sandpit , a sensory wall and a pond .
and there was a giant badger to help welcome the first guests

documents.title: cricket : devon malcolm remembers oval bowling performance
text: the oval is hosting its 100th test match today and one man with special memories of that ground is devon malcolm .
the former england fast bowler took 10 wickets in a match against the south africans there in 1994 , including nine in the second innings - the best by any bowler at the ground .

malcolm is in shropshire today to watch his son play and remembered how `` it all clicked '' for him on that day , but insists he bowled better for england in other games - particularly on tour in the west indies .

that 's not the quickest i 've bowled in test cricket , but to get results like that you 've got a bit of luck , the catches have got to be taken and it was one of those days when everything went well . ''
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: hospitals taking part in genome mapping study
text: the hospitals in shrewsbury and telford are taking part in an a pioneering genome mapping project run by nhs england .
it 's called the 100,000 genomes project - there are 17 hospital trusts around the country taking dna samples from consenting patients to look for genes related to rare diseases .
scientists can then use this information to improve their understanding of conditions like muscular dystrophy and cancer .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: telford likely to be relatively unaffected by brexit , says study
text: telford will probably see little impact from britain 's exit from the european union , according to research by the centre for cities think tank .

the study predicts affluent towns with cities with `` large high-skilled service sectors '' and `` highly skilled labour markets , significant numbers of innovative firms and strong business networks '' will see the biggest downturn in trade as a result of brexit .

at the other end of the scale it says `` less prosperous places in the north , midlands and wales '' with low-skill workforces and smaller private sectors will be less vulnerable to a potential downturn .
it ranks telford 55th out of the 62 towns and cities it rated , with aberdeen predicted to be the worst affected .
the shropshire local authority area is also predicted to see little impact .

documents.title: firefighters remain at scene of fire
text: firefighters remain at the scene of a large barn fire near whixall , which destroyed more than 100 tonnes of hay and straw .
it broke out at 01:45 at whixall hall farm and while the fire itself is out now , the crews are there to make sure it does n't reignite .

documents.title: telford football coach in court on sex claims
text: a school football coach has appeared in court charged with a string of child sexual offences .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: football : shrewsbury sign striker and say goodbye to goalie
text: shrewsbury town have added another striker , by taking 18-year-old niall ennis on a season-long loan from wolves .
but , there was a surprise move too , with young goalkeeper callum burton being sold to hull city for an undisclosed fee .

documents.title: your photos : red sky in the morning and cloudy fields
text: sailors take warning , we 've been sent this beautiful photo of a red sky this morning , taken by one of the bbc weather watchers in ludlow .
and this cloudy field was photographed near newport .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: sam allardyce to attend launch of torch relay
text: the former england manager sam allardyce will be among the people at the special olympic torch lighting ceremony in much wenlock this lunchtime .

he 'll be helping athletes with learning difficulties light the `` flame of hope '' , which will be met by other celebrities and public officials along its 200-mile journey to sheffield , for the start of the games .
the relay will take 10 days and is due to arrive at bramall lane in sheffield on tuesday 8 august .

documents.title: football : telford beat shrewsbury in friendly
text: afc telford united beat shrewsbury town in a friendly at the bucks head last night
both teams put out a mix of reserve and youth players and an early second half goal from elliot newby settled the tie .

both sides had been knocked out in the semi-finals of the shropshire senior cup and afterwards , telford cheekily tweeted that they could claim `` for this season at least , they 're shropshire 's 3rd best team '' .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: barn fire sees 100 tonnes of hay and straw destroyed
text: firefighters have been tackling a barn fire near whixall overnight that 's seen 100 tonnes of hay and straw go up in flames .
crews from oswestry , prees , shrewsbury and wem were called to whixall hall farm in dobsons bridge , just after 02:00 .
the fire has now been contained , but one crew remains on site .

documents.title: shrewsbury festival of literature to launch storytelling project
text: people who 've come to shropshire from overseas are being asked to tell their stories as part of shrewsbury 's festival of literature .
an open evening is being held tonight at pengwern books in shrewsbury , for people who might be interested in performing at the festival in november .
festival organisers are working with local storyteller fran o'boyle who will weave these stories into a performance work that will take place during the weekend of this year 's festival .

documents.title: football : shawbury united win shropshire senior cup for first time
text: shawbury united have won the shropshire senior cup for the first time in the club 's history .
they beat the new saints 1-0 through a first-half goal from liam armstrong .
shawbury got to the final by beating haughmond fc 2-0 and then shrewsbury town on penalties in the semi-final .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: shropshire couple at special celebration in london
text: a shropshire couple are taking part in special celebrations to mark the 50th anniversary of the 1967 sexual offences act in london today .
the famous piece of legislation decriminalised homosexual acts between two men of at least 21 years of age .
peter ruscoe and geoff hardy ( above ) were one of the first couples in britain to get a civil partnership .
later they 'll be at a lunch at the national liberal club attended by people who 've campaigned for reform .

documents.title: special olym torch in shropshire today
text: the torch relay for the special olym begins today in much wenlock .
next month 's event , which is held every four years , will see about 2,500 athletes with learning disabilities take part in sporting events in south yorkshire .
the flame will be travelling across the country over the next 10 days before arriving in sheffield in time for the opening ceremony .
author: Alex Seftel
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: safety demand for shropshire 's a525
text: a motorcyclist and a pedestrian died on a main road that has inadequate warning signs , an inquest heard .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: future of hospitals review under wraps
text: the public could get to have their say on hospital reorganisation in the county as early as september .
the future fit scheme was delayed after an independent review was ordered by the two clinical commissioning groups .

it followed an angry backlash over plans to downgrade the a & e at telford 's princess royal hospital and move its women and children 's unit over to the royal shrewsbury hospital to sit alongside a new enhanced emergency centre .
it 's understood that specialist consultant firm kpmg , which has carried out this review , has flagged up three areas of concern around the process .
it includes whether the money to make changes is in place .
the report has been written and it 's in circulation , but it 's under tight wraps .
kpmg did not want this information coming out prior to the forthcoming future fit board meeting on monday .
next month , the joint committee will meet to decide whether a public consultation can go ahead - possibly from september .
author: Joanne Gallacher
Political reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: a cloudy and breezy day with some bright spells mixed with scattered showers and highs of around 20c ( 68f ) .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning from the bbc shropshire newsroom
text: the team and i will be bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather between now and 18.00 .
you can comment on our stories and share your by email , facebook or twitter .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: wolves loan striker ennis to shrewsbury
text: wolves loan striker ennis to shrewsbury

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: harper adams 'self-wich ' photos prove popular
text: harper adams university has been making an impact at the royal welsh show , with a giant sandwich box .
visitors are being encouraged to stand inside and take a photo of themselves , as a human packed lunch .
the aim is to promote fresh produce and the university 's courses .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: weather : a dry night , but more rain tomorrow
text: most of us will have a dry night , but we 've got more rain forecast for tomorrow .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: shrewsbury get international backing for safe standing
text: fans from dortmund and orlando have been in touch with the shrewsbury town supporters parliament to support their bid to install rail seating at the montgomery waters meadow .
spokesman mike davies said british clubs were coming forward `` every day '' to back the plans to create the safe standing area .
shrewsbury are looking to be the first english club to install the chairs , but they are already being used overseas in countries including germany , scotland and the united states .
[ they ] have come forward and given us their backing and said this is working for us , this is a great thing to see for english football . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: decline in heating oil thefts
text: the number of thefts of heating oil in the west mercia and warwickshire police areas has been falling over the past three years , figures have revealed .
they dropped from 149 in 2014 to 39 last year , with the majority of those thefts reported in shropshire , herefordshire and worcestershire .
that trend ended in the first six months of 2017 , with 48 thefts being reported to police so far this year .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shrewsbury safe seating has cleared 'huge hurdle ' , says fans group
text: the shrewsbury town supporters parliament is confident of getting the final permission it needs to install a safe standing section at the montgomery waters meadow .
after winning approval for the scheme from the sports ground safety authority , the club now just needs shropshire council to issue a revised safety certificate for the ground .
mike davies , from the fans group , says he is not expecting that to be a problem and it will mainly involve agreeing how the new area will be managed on match days .
supporters will also have to raise the £ 75,000 needed to pay for the rail seats .

that [ the sfsa approval ] was a huge hurdle for us to jump and now it 's over to our local authority to speak to the football club , our safety officer and work on a variation to the safety certificate to the ground
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: shropshire runner 's latest world record bid is dashed
text: shropshire 's marathon world-record holder amy hughes has been told her latest challenge , running the most miles on a treadmill in seven days will not be recognised by guinness world records .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: football : shrewsbury and telford to play friendly
text: shrewsbury town will be playing a friendly against afc telford united at the bucks head tonight .
both teams are likely to put out reserve sides .
neither team made it through to the final of the shropshire senior cup final , which is also being played tonight .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: council confident of having enough school places
text: the number of secondary school places in telford will increase to keep pace with the expected growth in pupil numbers , telford and wrekin council says .
the authority is preparing for an extra 2,000 students by 2022 , with extra house building expected to bring more families to the area .
to cope with the demand , the council says it is looking at expanding the number of school places in north and south telford , wellington , hadley and newport .
we worked closely with planners and the design teams to ensure that all our secondary schools have the capacity to be expanded as the need arises .
the combined total of these places is in excess of any shortfall identified within our school organisation plan . ''

documents.title: baseball and pows in rare ww2 footage
text: the family of a usa soldier has released rare footage and photos that he took when stationed in the uk during world war two .
lt col quintus nicola was a major at the time he ran the 1,500-bed 82nd general hospital for us troops at iscoyd park on the shropshire/wales border .
the estate also contained a prisoner of war camp .

documents.title: your photos : rain in newport and ludlow
text: it 's clearing up a bit now , but it 's been pretty wet around the county today .
these photos were taken by bbc weather watchers near newport and ludlow .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: seafood prize for young shropshire chefs
text: a pair of young chefs from shropshire have won a prize at the uk young seafood chef of the year finals in grimsby .
adam ashley , 20 ( left ) , and 17-year-old joe little ( right ) , who are both students at new college , won top prize for their intermediate course .
they impressed the judges with their baked cod loin , salt baked beetroot ratatouille with rosemary and parmesan and finished fifth in the overall competition .

documents.title: football : shropshire senior cup final tonight
text: shawbury united face the new saints in the final of the shropshire senior cup tonight .
shawbury got there by beating shrewsbury town on penalties , while tns beat afc telford united 14-1 in their semi-final .
both shrewsbury and telford fielded youth sides in those matches , leading the chairman of the shropshire fa to call the two shock results an `` embarrassment '' to the competition .
the match will be played at yockings park , the home of whitchurch alport .

documents.title: ukip mep pulls out of leadership race
text: the west midlands euro mp , bill etheridge , has announced he 's withdrawing from ukip 's leadership contest .
the politician , who 's seen as being a moderate within the party , says he 's still to decide which of the other candidates he 'll support .

documents.title: owner of fly-tipped caravan fined
text: a man from the black country has been fined £ 700 by telford and wrekin council after his caravan was found dumped by the roadside , in cherrington near newport .
the authority said it was filled with rubbish , including large tree stumps , vehicle parts , a gas bottle and electrical equipment .
the caravan also contained paperwork , including invoices , family photos , concert tickets and employment , bank and dvla details , which were used to trace the owner .

the owner , who has n't been named by the council , admitted having a clear-out and hiring someone to dispose of it all and accepted two fixed penalty notices for fly-tipping and failing to check the credentials of the person he hired .

documents.title: safety authority approves shrewsbury safe standing move
text: shrewsbury town 's application to install a safe standing section at their stadium has been approved by the sports ground safety authority .
the supporters parliament , which was behind the bid , says it now plans to officially launch its fundraising efforts on 2 august .
the club will also have to apply to make changes to its stadium safety certificate before the seating can be installed .

documents.title: classic e-type jaguar to be restored
text: a bridgnorth firm which restores classic cars has started the task of piecing together the parts of one of the first 500 e-type jaguars , after they were discovered in france .
classic motor cars says it was built in 1961 and had been living in a garage in the suburbs of paris .
the company described the restoration as a `` challenging project '' and is also looking into the car 's files to find out more about its life .

documents.title: gkn sales and profits soar as pensions are shaken up
text: engineering giant gkn has delivered an increase in sales and profits - but said it is to close its defined benefit pensions scheme in a bid to narrow its pension deficit .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: your photos : rain falling in frodesley and oakengates
text: it 's been a morning to be indoors , with rain falling all over the county and this cat , photographed by a bbc weather watcher in oakengates , has the right idea .
it looks pretty grim on frodesley too .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: weston park music collection includes over 300 pieces
text: the collection of music discovered at weston park includes over 300 pieces and appears to have been built up over five generations of the family who lived there , the musical and amicable society says .

it believes the oldest work was written in the 17th century and says the collection includes known works by handel and purcell , alongside unknown ones which appear to have been commissioned by the bridgeman family and written by anonymous composers .
the society says some of the work , which is due to be put on show next week , is still in mint condition .

documents.title: shrewsbury loan smith to southport
text: shrewsbury town have loaned young centre-half dom smith to relegated national league north southport on a half-season loan .
smith , 21 , who has made 37 first-team appearances for the town , will be making his second loan move away from shropshire .
in august 2016 , the wales under-21 international joined barrow , spending two months with the national league side , where he made six appearances .
southport are managed by former afc telford united boss alan lewer .

documents.title: fundraising bid to get lost music recorded
text: there 's a bid to raise £ 2,000 to get a collection of music found at weston park professionally recorded .
the 200-year-old collection , largely written by anonymous composers , was rediscovered in 2014 and the music and amicable society wants to hire two cellists and a harpsichordist to play it .

the music includes 25 pieces for cello and the plan is to record it inside weston park and the society says it has already got the funding to cover the artist and engineer fees , but needs the £ 2,000 to pay for the recording costs .

documents.title: football : shrewsbury fight back for friendly win
text: shrewsbury town fought back from 1-0 down to beat cardiff city in a home friendly last night .
the visitors led through nathaniel mendez-laing at half time , but shrewsbury scored twice in the second half through a shaun whalley penalty and a goal from louis dodds .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: your comments : the future of shrewsbury shopping centres
text: the future of shrewsbury 's shopping centres has been generating some debate on the bbc radio shropshire facebook page after it emerged the subject had been discussed by councillors behind closed doors yesterday .
steve bowdler said the town needed a major department store and added , `` the two centres need to merge and the riverside shopping mall needs knocking down '' .
annette knight had a different idea , writing : `` reduce the business rates and rent to encourage more independent shops , which will bring back the market town feel to shrewsbury '' .
and there was some argument over whether the future was out-of-town stores with graham blunt writing `` i 'd rather go to a retail park or telford now . ''
and julie fox responding with `` telford and out of town areas are soul-less and like any other elsewhere .
shrewsbury town is unique '' .

documents.title: lost music collection to be performed
text: weston park is to host a concert showcasing a music collection which has been hidden for over 200 years .
it belongs to the bridgeman family and was discovered stored in tin trunks at their ancestral home in 2014 .
the concert will take place next wednesday evening and the original 250-year-old manuscripts will also be on display for visitors to see .

documents.title: cyclist taken to hospital after newport crash
text: a cyclist was taken to hospital after an accident just outside newport .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: woman criticises hospital after daughter 's death
text: a woman has criticised hospital staff for failing to spot a rare condition that killed her daughter .
katie widdowson , 23 , from telford , died earlier this year after catching a flesh-eating disease .
an inquest has since found `` clear failures '' at good hope hospital in sutton coldfield .
she should have had a blood test taken .
she was left in a waiting room for three hours and then sent home with a sprained wrist .
the coroner established had katie been treated correctly , she most definitely would have survived . ''
the hospital trust has apologised to the family , but does n't wish to comment further .

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: a spell of wet and rather windy weather will move east across the region this morning , with some heavy rain in places .
most areas will become dry during the afternoon and skies will brighten later .
however , it will remain breezy - highs of 21c ( 70f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: welcome to our live updates for the day
text: welcome to live updates from bbc shropshire on wednesday morning .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid or message via facebook .

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on wednesday , but keep an eye out here for more updates before then .

documents.title: belton farm sweep the cheese board at nantwich
text: the shropshire cheese maker belton farm has had another good year at the international cheese awards at nantwich , winning 15 gold awards , 12 silver , one bronze and five highly commended .
the awards included a gold , a silver and a bronze in the cheshire cheese category .

documents.title: weather : a cooler end to the week on the way
text: there might be some rain around tomorrow and we are forecast a cooler end to the week .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: waterloo general 's medals sold for £ 8k
text: waterloo general 's medals sold for £ 8k

documents.title: woman dragged from car and robbed of rings
text: a woman has had her wedding and engagement rings stolen after being dragged out her car in telford .
police say it happened outside her home in the woodside area of town yesterday morning .
her attacker is described as being scruffy with paint-spattered clothes , with dark hair and a birmingham accent - and he smelt of alcohol and cannabis .

documents.title: overturned trailer causes big delays on a5 near shrewsbury
text: an overturned trailer caused big delays on the a5 from shrewsbury this morning .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: cheese industry award for whitchurch woman
text: a whitchurch woman has been given a cheese industry award for her `` invaluable contribution to the uk dairy industry '' .
brenda davies received the british cheese board prize at the international cheese awards in nantwich today .

she has spent more than 20 years working for a number of producers and the chief executive of the industry body , dairy uk , said she had `` dedicated her career to the quality of our great british cheeses '' .

documents.title: watch : hos director delighted with ward refurbishment
text: fundraisers at severn hos say they are delighted with the upgraded perry ward in shrewsbury .
it was the original part of the hos when it was first built over 25 years ago , and has had a £ 700,000 refurbishment .
but , the hos director of care , heather palin , said there is more work to be done .

documents.title: secret meeting discusses shopping centres
text: members of shropshire council 's cabinet met behind closed doors earlier to discuss the shrewsbury 's darwin , pride hill and riverside shopping centres and the authority 's role in their future .
they said they agreed that more work should be carried out before a report is brought back to the committee before christmas , but would not say what was discussed .
the possible redevelopment of the shopping centres has been on the cards for years , with no signs of major progress and there has been talk of incorporating the town 's bus station into them .

documents.title: hospital boss responds to criticism of leadership
text: the man in charge of hospitals in shrewsbury and telford has hit back at claims of `` indecision and bureaucratic incompetence '' at the nhs trust .
those were the words of the telford mp lucy allan last week , on the same day telford and wrekin council passed a vote of no confidence in simon wright and his leadership team .
but he insisted they were not `` sat on their hands , not acting '' and were frustrated that progress was n't being made on plans to reorganise services at the two hospitals .
the review has taken over three years and has recommended downgrading telford 's a & e department and moving specialist women and children 's services to shrewsbury , but has yet to be confirmed .
mr wright said the decision could n't be made by the shrewsbury and telford hospital trust alone and needed the agreement of four other nhs partners .

and he said he wanted to take the plans to public consultation as soon as possible saying , `` i think it 's wrong that the public have had to wait this long to have their voice heard on the subject '' .
i am frustrated that it has taken as long as it has but the key thing for me now is , let 's make this decision .
my consultants , my nurses my therapists are screaming out for us to make a decision , that 's what we need to do . ''

documents.title: watch : 'thunderbird ' off to europe
text: this £ 400 jaguar xj is heading off on a charity drive tomorrow .
craig cantwell , who works as a technician at telford 's princess royal hospital , has transformed this car to resemble the vehicle driven by virgil tracy in thunderbirds .
the 31-year old 's part of a team called `` bangers and smash '' driving from the uk , across europe , in a rally called the banger italia .

documents.title: napoleonic commander 's medal-brooch sells for £ 7,800
text: a brooch made for a napoleonic war officer from shropshire has sold at auction for £ 7,800 .
it features four medals awarded to lieutenant general rowland hill and had been listed by auctioneers hansons with a guide price of between £ 1,000 and £ 2,000 .
the lieutenant general fought at the battle of waterloo and survived a musket ball to the head while serving in egypt in 1801 and also led men in france , spain and portugal .
the rarity and historical importance of this item can not be overstated , lieutenant-general hill was a hugely respected and successful army officer . ''

documents.title: your photos : sunny weather in oswestry and ludlow
text: there 's some welcome sunshine in the photos being shared by the bbc weather watchers today .
these ones were taken near oswestry ( top ) and ludlow ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: football : telford defender leaves club
text: afc telford united defender ben bailey has left the club , saying he wants to play more regular football .
the club says he contacted manager rob edwards on monday morning to pass on his decision .
bailey said afterwards it was a `` joy to play football at such a great set up '' and that the decision to move on was his .
i do n't feel i have had enough playing time this pre-season to show my best and to do that i need be playing more . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: napoleonic medal-brooch to be sold at auction
text: a brooch featuring medals awarded to a shropshire officer who served in the napoleonic wars are being sold at auction today .
the auctioneers hansons say it belonged to lieutenant-general rowland hill , from hawkstone park , who had the nickname `` daddy hill '' because of the care he gave his troops .
general hill fought at the battle of waterloo and was made commander-in-chief of the british army in 1828 , succeeding wellington .

the medals include the knight grand cross of the order of the bath ; the knight grand cross of the royal guelphic order , the grand cross of the order of the tower and the sword and the peninsular cross .

documents.title: post box collection changes for shropshire postcode branded 'crazy '
text: collection times for post boxes across the sy postcode area are to be brought forward in a move today branded crazy '' .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: photos show life at ww2 hospital
text: a collection of photos showing life at the iscoyd park war hospital near whitchuch , which belonged to an american soldier , are being shared by his family .
major quintus nicola served there during the second world war and his son , dennis nicola , wanted to show them to the modern-day owners of the house .
the hospital was demolished in 1957 , but during the war it had 1,500 beds and as well as taking in allied soldiers , it gave treatment to prisoners of war .
the photo collection also includes these believed to show injured german and polish soldiers arriving at malpas railway station .

documents.title: council warned of 'huge tidal wave ' of new pupils
text: telford faces a `` huge tidal wave '' of new school pupils , the leader of the conservative opposition group on telford and wrekin council has warned .
andrew eade said the authority had spent money collected from levies on housing developments on primary schools , but there could be problems when they reach secondary school age .
the labour-run council says it has plans to increase the number of school places .

the borough have been able to collect money from builders to build primary schools and they 've done that , but there 's this huge tidal wave of pupils coming through as they get older and they will need secondary education of course . ''

documents.title: football : ogogo named town captain
text: shrewsbury town have appointed abu ogogo as their new team captain for the coming season .
in a double appointment , mat sadler has been named the overall club captain .
it 's great news .
i try to play the same way whether i 've got the armband or not , but for the gaffer to put his faith in me to lead the boys i 'm happy about that .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: mytton oak road crash driver treated for heart attack
text: the driver of a car involved in a collision with a 14-year-old girl was treated at the scene for a possible heart attack .
the crash happened on mytton oak road in shrewsbury , near to the co-op store , at about 17:00 yesterday .
the teenage girl was flown to alder hey children 's hospital in liverpool with severe injuries to both legs and her pelvis .
the elderly woman driver was taken to the royal shrewsbury hospital .

documents.title: son of american major returns to site of former war hospital
text: an american man is visiting shropshire today to share his father 's memories of a second world war hospital near whitchurch .
major quintus nicola was stationed at iscoyd park , which had a 1,500-bed hospital built in its grounds , along with a prisoner of war camp which treated german soldiers .
dennis nicola has come over with his family with letters , photographs and a film of his father 's time at the camp and he plans to show them to the current owners of the house .
the hospital was eventually demolished in 1957 and today iscoyd park is a private house and wedding venue .

documents.title: cost of holiday childcare risen by 82 % in the west midlands
text: the cost of holiday childcare has risen by more than 82 % across the west midlands since 2010 , labour has said .
shadow education secretary angela rayner said the situation was made worse because incomes had fallen in real terms over the same period .
nationally there has been a rise of 50 % , according to ms rayner .
the tories said labour had `` blundered '' because the party was in charge of childcare in wales , where they said rises had been double the national average .

documents.title: football : town face cardiff in pre-season friendly
text: there could be some indication of paul hurst 's starting xi for shrewsbury town 's opening league game of the season .
town host cardiff in another friendly this evening having already beaten aston villa and wolves .
tonight it 'll be a case of a team to perhaps look at something slightly different but a lot of the principles we 're starting to nail down . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: stadium standing area backed by hillsborough relative
text: a worcestershire woman who lost her brother in the hillsborough disaster is backing plans to introduce a safe standing area at shrewsbury town 's ground .
andrew brookes ( died in the 1989 tragedy , which led to the introduction of all-seater stadiums .
his sister louise , from bromsgrove , the fact that there was standing on the terraces at hillsborough was not the reason why 96 people died .
if i really did believe that standing was dangerous and not safe i would be the first one to be up in arms with my banner complaining . ''

documents.title: projected pupil rise in telford
text: concerns have been raised that there 's a potential shortfall of secondary school places in telford and wrekin from next year .
council papers show there 's a projected rise in pupil numbers of over 2,000 by 2022 .
the increase is down to larger primary school numbers filtering into high schools and more houses being built .
the authority says it has contingency plans designed to increase capacity across the borough .

documents.title: your stunning sunset and sunrise
text: you 've been out taking some beautiful shots of the shropshire last night and early this morning .
thanks to our weather watchers for these photos in whitchurch ( top ) and longnor ( bottom ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: child 'seriously injured ' after being hit by car on shrewsbury 's mytton oak road
text: a busy shrewsbury road was closed and a child taken to hospital after being hit by a car .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: straw bales alight near bridgnorth
text: four fire crews were called to deal with a large fire in morville last night .
thirty tonnes of baled straw were ablaze when fire crews arrived .
beaters and a fogging system were used to put out the fire .

documents.title: appeal after child hit car near fatal crash scene
text: police are appealing for witnesses after a young child was seriously injured after being hit by a car in mytton oak road in shrewsbury .
it happened close to the co-op store yesterday afternoon .
the air ambulance was called after the collision with a silver peugeot .
the crash happened in the same spot where last month an 11-year-old girl , olivia-violet reeves , was killed after being knocked down by a car .
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: video : your 50-second weather forecast
text: after a cloudy start it should be a dry and clear day with sunny spells and top temperatures of 22c ( 72f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: welcome to our live updates for the day
text: good morning from the bbc shropshire newsroom .
i 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , or contact us on twitter or facebook .
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tracking down the ww1 grave markers
text: tracking down the ww1 grave markers
author: Jon Welch
BBC News

documents.title: child hit by car in shrewsbury
text: a young child has been seriously injured after being hit by a car on mytton oak road in shrewsbury .
the air ambulance was called after the collision with a silver peugeot .
the crash happened in the same area where last month an 11-year-old girl was killed by a car .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: athletics : bushell delighted with silver after year of struggle
text: after a series of injuries and illnesses , the telford wheelchair athlete mickey bushell was delighted to claim silver at the world para athletics championships in london at the weekend .
he said it was `` a pleasure and an honour '' to win it in the stadium where he won paralympic gold in 2012 .
bushell missed out on the last world championships through injury and finished sixth at the rio games .
it 's been a long time coming , i 've struggled since 2012 really and i really wanted to come back for this race .
this is back in the home crowd and it 's a pleasure and an honour to win it in front of the crowd . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: bridgnorth adventurer ant looking to the far east
text: adventurer ant eddies-davies is expanding his business to the far east after winning a prestigious contract in china .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: weather : more light cloud and some sunshine
text: we 're forecast another mild night and tomorrow we 'll have more of this light cloud , with some sunshine around .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: new panoramic film about shropshire goes on show
text: panoramic drone footage of the county 's landscape has gone on show for the first time at the shropshire hills discovery centre in craven arms today .
it is replacing one filmed from a hot air balloon and narrated by the late actor pete postlethwaite , who used to live in the county .
the new film is voiced by his son , billy postlethwaite .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: police fly flag to mark 50th anniversary decriminalising homosexuality
text: west mercia police say they 'll be flying a rainbow flag at full mast above their headquarters at hindlip hall to mark the 50th anniversary of the partial decriminalisation of male homosexuality in england and wales .
the sexual offences act was passed on 27 july 1967 and was the first stepping stone in paving the way for equal rights for the lesbian , gay , bi-sexual and transgender communities .
west mercia say they wish to celebrate the milestone and also to demonstrate the force 's commitment to the lgbt communities .
this is a visible reminder to how society and the police have moved on since 1967 , and how attitudes have truly changed in the 25 years i have been a police officer .
we now have a more representative police service that wants to hear about the things that affect the lbgt communities in warwickshire and west mercia . ''

documents.title: your photos : cloudy afternoon in shropshire
text: here 's a couple of photos sent in by our readers this afternoon .
they were shared on the bbc weather watchers website .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: rise in crimes involving children aged 10 and under
text: the number of recorded crimes in shropshire involving children aged 10 and under has risen steadily over the last four years , police figures have revealed .
across the county , west mercia police said there were 68 crimes in which a children 10 years or younger were a suspect in 2013 - that rose to 93 in 2014 , then 133 in 2015 and 198 last year .
in 2013 and 2014 , two-thirds of the crimes were recorded in the telford area , but the difference narrowed considerably in 2015 and 2016 .
across the whole force area the total number of crimes recorded in 2016-17 was 80,936 .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: crowd funding specialists brought in for safe standing project
text: a company that specialises in crowd funding campaigns has been brought in to help raise money for a safe standing section at shrewsbury town 's stadium .
the club is looking to install about 500 rail seats in its salop leisure stand and fans are hoping to raise the £ 75,000 needed for the project themselves .
tifosy says it has helped clubs in england and italy raise money for all sorts of things , from a statue outside a ground , to a complete stand at stevenage fc .
it [ crowdfunding ] works well with sports , because associated to each club you 've got a lot of loyal fans who feel strongly about that club and want to make something happen . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: stars attract 1,700 fans to shrewsbury international comedy festival
text: organisers were left overwhelmed after more than 1,700 people turned out for the first annual shrewsbury international comedy festival which included household names joe lycett , tom wrigglesworth and greg davies .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: watch : swimming club wants 50m pool
text: ellesmere titans swimming club is looking to build on its links with ellesmere college and offer `` american style '' scholarships for young swimmers .
and head coach alan bircher says they also want to have a 50m pool to train in .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: your photos : butterflies in oswestry and flowers in condover
text: we 've had some really colourful photos from the bbc weather watchers today .
these ones were taken in oswestry ( top ) and condover ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: motorcyclist dead after lorry crash
text: police have confirmed a motorcyclist has died after his bike collided with a lorry on the a464 between shifnal and codsall .
the crash happened at 10:49 near cosford grange farm and the road has been closed temporarily .

documents.title: cricket : lords honour for shropshire cricketer
text: laura macleod from burleydam , near whitchurch , has been made an honorary member of the mcc , along with 36 other women .
the ex-england player was at lords yesterday to be welcomed in and said she was `` truly honoured '' .

she has played for her country at lords on a number of occasions and said she had seen the long room before , but said watching the game from the committee room , where the royal family sit was `` truly amazing '' .
author: Kate Tebby
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: fire in uffington bedroom
text: firefighters were called out to a bedroom fire in uffington at 05:53 this morning .
the three people inside the house on uffington lane in uffington got out safely and were unhurt .

documents.title: honour for czech pair who assassinated senior nazi
text: the czech pair who were honoured with a memorial stone in shropshire at the weekend were responsible for the assassination of reinhard heydrich , one of the most senior figures in germany 's third reich .

jan kubis ( right ) , jozef gabcik ( left ) and another man , josef valcik , parachuted into czechoslovakia in 1942 , and attacked the senior nazi on a road near prague - heydrich died from his injuries eight days later .
all three men were killed following the raid as they hid from the nazis in a church crypt .

heydrich was the overall head of security in nazi germany and a leading architect of the final solution and hitler responded to his death by rounding up and killing thousands of czechs , including the families of the three men .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: air ambulance looking forward to bigger aircraft
text: paramedic ian lock is looking forward to the midlands air ambulance getting a bigger aircraft .

documents.title: football : shrewsbury beat strong wolves side
text: shrewsbury town beat a strong wolverhampton wanderers side in a friendly at the weekend .
they struck twice in the first half through alex rodman ( below ) and carlton morris , in front of a crowd of 5,408 .
the wolves team included a number of their recent imports , including their £ 15.8m portuguese midfielder reuben neves .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: motorbike and lorry collide on a464
text: the emergency services are at the scene of a crash between a motorbike and a lorry on the a464 between shifnal and codsall , at cosford grange .
the collision was reported at 10:49 and the fire service said it was working to release a person trapped .

documents.title: cricket : ex-england cricketer enjoys 'totally amazing ' world cup win
text: former england cricketer laura macleod , who lives in burleydam near whitchurch , says the women 's game will get a huge boost from england 's win in the world cup final yesterday .
she said it was a `` totally amazing day , right from getting on the train '' and said everyone in the sell-out crowd seemed to have a wonderful day .

macleod said the women 's game has been gaining popularity and that the result is `` just going to raise it even higher '' , adding the interest in the final proved `` people want to watch it and it 's entertaining cricket '' .

we will need to put some things together to make sure that we can cope with the demand and i think we are getting to a point now where it is more acceptable , and quite rightly , for women and girls to play . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: athletics : silver for telford wheelchair racer
text: telford 's mickey bushell came second in the finals of the t53 100m at the world para athletics championships in london yesterday .
the paralympic gold medal winner recorded a time of 14.85 and finished behind canadian brent lakatos .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: football : telford sign trialist dwyer
text: afc telford united have signed trialist anthony dwyer after he scored three goals in pre-season friendlies .
the 20-year-old striker has been playing for stafford rangers , matlock and ilkeston since being released by mansfield town last year .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: shropshire memorial stone for czech soldiers
text: a small memorial stone , celebrating a friendship between a shropshire family and two czechoslovakian soldiers , will be officially unveiled today .
it 's part of a ceremony taking place in the village of ightfield , where jozef gabcik and jan kubis were based during world war two .
the pair were later instrumental in the assassination of a high ranking nazi official , in a mission known as operation anthropoid .

documents.title: bridge near shawbury closed for repairs
text: a bridge north of shawbury is expected to be closed for up to two weeks from today .
parapet repairs are being carried out on stanton river bridge by the village of moreton corbet .
traffic is being diverted via the b5063 wem to shawbury road and the a53 .
shropshire council says it appreciates the closure will cause some inconvenience .

documents.title: your glorious view and bright blue skies
text: here 's two of our favourite bbc weather watcher sent in from the weekend .
church stretton is the backdrop for this incredible sent in by giveitaminute .
peter steggles took this in longnor , what a gorgeous mediterranean looking blue sky .
if you have a you 'd like to share , send it in to us here and we 'll feature our favourites .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: yobs trash memorial garden to telford war hero
text: a garden created to remember a telford war hero killed in afghanistan has been trashed by yobs who trampled flowers and stole ornaments .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: shropshire health services not meeting smear result deadline
text: nhs figures put shropshire below the national average in terms of meeting the government deadline for sending out smear test results .
the bbc 's learned that 80 % of local health services are failing to meet the two-week deadline .
in the year 2015-16 , shropshire women had to wait longer in more than 3,000 cases .
radio shropshire has asked the local clinical commissioning groups for a response .
author: BBC Shropshire

documents.title: m54 tailbacks clearing
text: long delays are staring to clear on the m54 eastbounds after a vehicle fire closed the carriageway at one of the busiest times of the day .
it is expected to take some time for tailbacks to clear completely .
# m54 e/b btwn j3 + j2 , vehicle fire extinguished and all lanes are open .
delays are clearing .
safe travels .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: video : your 50-second weather forecast
text: after a cloudy start and the possibility of a few showers we can expect a generally dry day with highs of 21c ( 70f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: welcome to our live updates for the day
text: welcome to live updates from bbc shropshire on monday morning .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid or message via facebook .
